There was a new election in Spain and the socialist party won. They now plan to pull out of Iraq. 
 
 The terror attack in Spain hit right before the election and may have swayed the election, some say. It has been speculated that Al Qaeda attacked in order to change the government in Spain and hopefully get them out of Iraq. Do you think that this could have been their goal (If Al Qaeda is responsible)?
 
 If so, it appears Al Qaeda wants Westerners to stop meddling in the Middle East. Then there must be a purpose to Al Qaeda's attacks. There reason must go beyond just wanting to kill non-Muslims. 
 
 Comments?

post_info.post_title: Spain may pull out of Iraq

One more point. I bet if they hit here in the US again, it would have the opposite effect and Bush would be re-elected. What do you think?
 
 Here is a link to a story:
 
 http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A61727-2004Mar15.html
 
 The Spanish Response 
 
 Tuesday, March 16, 2004; Page A20 
 
 
 SPANISH VOTERS no doubt wished to rebuke the ruling Popular Party for its wrong-footed reaction to last week's terrorist bombing in Madrid, and its support for the United States in Iraq. Fair enough -- but it's hard not to be concerned about how the message was likely received outside the country, by the leaders of al Qaeda and other Islamic terrorist organizations. 
 
 Before the bombing, the Popular Party was favored to win comfortably; after the devastating attack, and an al Qaeda statement saying its intent was to punish Spain for its role in Iraq, the election was swept by the opposition -- and its leader immediately pledged to withdraw Spanish troops and cool relations with Washington. The rash response by Jose Luis Rodriguez Zapatero, Spain's prime minister-elect, will probably convince the extremists that their attempt to sway Spanish policy with mass murder succeeded brilliantly. ...

If the former spanish leader didnt get involved in a war that had nothing to do with him, and if he didnt drag his country into an illegal war, then spain would not have been a target.
 
 Dont fuel the fire and you wont burn your hands.

This war does have to do with the Spanish, it does involve them. The enemy here is militant Islamic extremists. If you don't agree with them and appease them, you are a target. Just think of this; France has opposed the United States in absolutely everything in the war on terror, and yet they've recently received threats that they will be attacked if they pass legislation outlawing traditional Muslim headscarves in public schools.
 
 If you are a nation that does not support the current militant Islam movement, you are a target. If you are a western nation, you are a target.

This is most certainly an aggressive rebuttal to Spain's involvement in the Iraqi War. It's definitely not Eta, because they've never been hesitant to stake claim to involvement in any large-scale terror attacks. I'm guessing this is al-Qaeda, directly, or a constituent or compatriot of the al-Qaeda network. Really, it's not a bad move. For the most part, this war has been completed, and our vague goals have been consummated, I suppose. Spain's involvement was fairly minimal, right? They'll still reap some of the advantages from their involvement in this travesty of a war, regardless of whether their cowardice dictates their actions. Really, I'd just pull out and spare the citizens. America's concrete enough to complete this war, and the bulk of the coalition wasn't Spanish, right?

 I think a better analogy is this: Your neighbor told you the guy across the street was going to attack him. So you and your neighbor grab your guns and go kill the guy across the street. Would you normally do these things? 
 
 The President said there was NO evidence that Saddam was involved in 9-11. Also, we should not care what the Iraqi's think. What was your point there?

I guess the point is that many people said that the only reason al Qaeda hit us on 9-11 was because we were non-Muslim. According to OBL we were hit because we gave money and weapons to Israel and we stationed troops in Saudi Arabia.
